contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox settlement | name = Kleszczele | image_flag = | image_shield = POL Kleszczele COA.svg | image_skyline = Kleszczele Cerkiew Zasniecie front-side view.jpg | image_caption = Orthodox church | pushpin_map = Poland | coordinates_region = PL | subdivision_type = Country | subdivision_name = {{POL}} | subdivision_type1 = [[Voivodeships of Poland|Voivodeship]] | subdivision_name1 = [[Podlaskie Voivodeship|Podlaskie]] | subdivision_type2 = [[Powiat|County]] | subdivision_name2 = [[Hajnówka County|Hajnówka]] | subdivision_type3 = [[Gmina]] | subdivision_name3 = [[Gmina Kleszczele|Kleszczele]] | area_total_km2 = 46.71 | population_as_of = 2006 | population_total = 1432 | population_density_km2 = auto | latd = 52 | latm = 34 | lats = 36 | latNS = N | longd = 23 | longm = 19 | longs = 17 | longEW = E | elevation_m = | website = http://www.kleszczele.fr.pl }} '''Kleszczele''' {{IPAc-pl|k|l|e|sz|'|cz|e|l|e}} ({{lang-uk|Кліщелі}}, ''Klishcheli'') is a town in [[Hajnówka County]], [[Podlaskie Voivodeship]], north-eastern [[Poland]]. Prior to 1999, it was in [[Białystok Voivodeship (1975–1998)]]. The Yiddish playwright [[Peretz Hirschbein]] was born in Kleszczele in 1881. {{coord|52|35|N|23|19|E|region:PL_type:city|display=title}} {{commonscat|Kleszczele}} {{Gmina Kleszczele}} [[Category:Cities and towns in Podlaskie Voivodeship]] [[Category:Hajnówka County]] {{Hajnówka-geo-stub}}
